Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery open vase, possibly a Type A kantharos; creamy white slip; interior glazed black with row of added white zigzags between white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of black chiton with dotted paryphe; on left, painted inscription.
Curator's comments: Lemos produced two different catalogue entries for this sherd (no. 749 and 975), in two different style groups (Chalice Style and Grand Style) and as two different shapes (chalice and kantharos). The depiction of the chiton is similar to other Grand Style sherds. See British Museum 1924,1201.384, 1888,0601.493.c. If this sherd belongs to a kantharos, it belongs in Williams' Type A group (Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169). Kantharoi in this group are dated between 600BC-575BC, pre-dating the Chalice Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 277, no. 749, pl. III, pl. 98, p. 296, no. 975)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 720, no. 784)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 61, pl. 34, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1660) (phase 2)
